text: Ni Cong (30 May 1935 – 3 July 2022), courtesy name Yiming, better known by his pen name Ni Kuang (also romanised Ngai Hong, I Kuang and Yi Kuang), was a Hong Kong novelist and screenwriter. He wrote over 300 Chinese-language novels, and more than 400 movie scripts. His best known movies were One-Armed Swordsman (1967) and The Seventh Curse (1986). He was born in Shanghai.
